org.flixel
Class FlxGame

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxGame

public class FlxGame
extends java.lang.Object

FlxGame is the heart of all flixel games, and contains a bunch of basic game loops and things. It is a long and sloppy file that you shouldn't have to worry about too much! It is basically only used to create your game object in the first place, after that FlxG and FlxState have all the useful stuff you actually need.

useDefaultHotKeys

MENU to pause.

pause

public FlxGroup pause
Displayed whenever the game is paused. Override with your own FlxLayer for hot custom pause action! Defaults to data.FlxPause.

stage

public SurfaceView stage

FlxGame

public FlxGame(int GameSizeX,
               int GameSizeY,
               java.lang.Class<? extends FlxState> InitialState,
               Context context,
               java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object> Resource)
Game object constructor - sets up the basic properties of your game.

Parameters:
GameSizeX - The width of your game in pixels (e.g. 320).
GameSizeY - The height of your game in pixels (e.g. 240).
InitialState - The class name of the state you want to create and switch to first (e.g. MenuState).
context -
Resource -

Parameters:
